Ready to start the next chapter in your career journey? You’re in the right place. We’re always happy to hear from people who are eager to learn and grow, and share our values. Welcome home.We're looking for Tech Lead/ArchitectTech Lead's / Architects at Futurice are generalists working across industries to help clients solve their important challenges in business and technology. They work with digital services, software development and improving how digital is done in big organizations. They have a wide understanding of technology and a toolset of modern frameworks and methodologies. Tech Lead's/Architects often have years of experience in software development but have extended the scope of problems to tackle as they also want to see the impact being made to organizational issues. Here are some examples of our expertise:DevOps & Cloud architectureSolid experience with AWS, Google Cloud and/or Microsoft AzureDesigning for Single Cloud provider or Hybrid Cloud scenariosDeveloping complex scenarios using cloud agnostic stacksSecurity architectureFacilitating Threat Modeling & Risk Management workshopsSecurity Auditing and recommending code pipeline best practicesAI & Data architectureBuilding Data Lake and Data Warehousing solutions in the CloudAnalytics, Visualizations and Business Intelligence systems (e.g. Splunk, Kibana, PowerBI, QlikView, QuickSight, Data Studio, etc)AI/Machine Learning model creation and training (e.g. Tensorflow, Apache MXNet)Additionally, you will take a significant role in shaping the architecture team and contributing to our company thought leadership efforts. Due to the exploratory nature of this role, you will also assist in account management and sales related activities.Are you our new colleague?You have a broad knowledge of tools, frameworks and technologies related to designing, implementing, deploying and hosting software services.Solid experience in at least one of the following Architecture domains: DevOps & Cloud, Security and/or Data & AIStrong expertise in agile software development and methods (e.g. Scrum, Kanban).You have experience in designing and implementing modern REST-based APIs, using e.g. Java, Scala, or Node.js.You have a good understanding of both relational databases as well as no-SQL databases.Good leadership skills in achieving momentum, action and resultsAbility to ask the right questions and drive troubleshooting with expertsThought leader and influencer: public speaking, tech articles, etc.Willingness to take a step in the abstraction level to solve organizational issues and drive towards results in big projects.Ability to work in diverse work cultures and comfortable with nonhierarchical organizations.Fluent English is required, Finnish skills is a plus.If you get good vibes after reading this, we would love to hear from you!Please check the application form behind the link to show your interest and tell us a bit about your career background and why you are motivated to become part of the Futu family.

As a Data Engineer you get a deep-dive into clients’ data!We hope you are ready to get your hands dirty with designing, building, automating and operating data platforms and data pipelines. It’s all about putting your mind into automating infrastructure, monitoring and recovery routines. Overall, the key is being curious, solving problems and recognising how to interact with different types of data and people. All the work we do is about helping and guiding our clients, so having a true consultant mindset and interest in supporting sales is what we value dearly.In our work as consultants we give high fives to agile ways of working and the importance of transparency and trust in teamwork. As a Data Engineer you have talented professionals around you such as data scientists, software developers, designers and of course our clients and their end-users. You will work with a variety of projects, domains and business cases; Lately, we have been working with data architecture of a media company, building a real-time chat spam detector for a gaming company, and making data more accessible on a governmental organization.Here are some practical things we’d love to see in your back pocketExperience on data stack on AWS (e.g. RedShift, Glue, Athena) or on Azure (e.g. Data Factory, Synapse, Databricks)Strong know-how on building, deploying and orchestrating data infrastructure (e.g. serverless computation, Sagemaker, CI tools, Terraform, or similar tools). You have a dev-ops oriented mindset.An excellent understanding of databases. Relational databases are most often used, but many projects also employ document databases, key-value stores, and related technologies.Practical software experience from a variety of projects. Python or Java experience is on top of our list right now, but other languages are definitely considered as a plus too!Appreciation for a good communication with both the team and the clients. You are fluent at least in English and hopefully also in Finnish.We offer you the Ultimate Learning PlatformWith us you get the opportunity to work with the most motivated and multi talented forces in development, design and strategy. As an agency, we have a versatile portfolio of projects and we solve different kinds of problems that require different kinds of tools – for you this means the chance of a lifetime to follow your learning goals and broaden your skill set. You will be inspired and supported throughout your journey as our aspiration is to be the Ultimate Learning Platform for your career. We are a people-first-company and believe that at the end of the day happy people are the key to great software and happy clients.If you get good vibes after reading this, we would love to hear from you!Please check the application form behind the link to show your interest and tell us a bit about your career background and why you are motivated to become part of the Futu family.

Our impact-driven tech community is looking for senior software developers who are motivated by working on software that has a measurable effect on business.Who We AreColumbia Road builds seamless and commercially effective customer journeys that create impact. We help our clients get more revenue and more customers, but also to sell better. Our tight-knit team consists of business consultants who understand software and of highly talented business-driven design and technology specialists. We believe that technology is a tool that we need to master, but the actual business impact of the service is the first thing we want to understand and select proper tooling after that.Take a look at our Culture Code & People to get to know us better. We come 100% recommended on Glassdoor with a 4.8/5 score.Columbia Road is a part of the Futurice family of companies.The Job & What You’d Be Working OnAs a senior software consultant at Columbia Road, you will be working in a high-impact role in the core of our clients’ businesses:You’ll code, build storefronts, and work with APIs and integrations You’ll advise, design, and implement the tech needed to drive business results forwardYou’ll be a trusted advisor and a sparring partner to important client stakeholdersYour contribution will have a significant effect on the client’s successRoadies work as diverse teams of digital sales experts, tailored to each project. The more experience you have, the more you'll be able to take responsibility for your client projects and coach other Roadies. You’d often be responsible for the completion of a challenging project or activities in which you take ownership of a team.Columbia Road’s focus on digital sales still means that we are tackling a large variety of projects ranging from ecommerce platforms and data platform projects to site optimisation and mobile development. To mention a few:We help Elisa run modern online sales in a fully integrated teamWe’re helping Vahterus on their digital sales transformation journeyWe’re working with Posti on a scalable ecommerce platform.Our ways of workingAs we believe that best results arise from employee freedom, all teams have wide latitude to choose the best tools and ways of working for themselves and the people in the client organisation. Even as your focus is likely on some part of the stack (frontend, backend, integrations or other), we value people who aren’t too afraid to get their hands dirty with the other areas when necessary.All of our consultants work directly with client stakeholders to build a good understanding of their business and its challenges. While development is probably where most of your time goes, we are in the business of creating impact for our clients, and that means spending some time to understand how the business functions.We help our clients in translating business opportunities into actionable plans and concrete solutions. Read more about how we code and design high performing digital sales channels. When it comes to remote versus on-site, we are flexible and always work according to what’s best for our clients - we hope that you can commit to spending at least a few days a week at our client’s premises.We offer a wide range of learning opportunities as continuous learning is one of our core values, therefore you will be offered various learning opportunities in your daily work as well as internal learning events, training, and meetups to share and enlarge your knowledge.Professional Benefits For YouA high-impact role as a trusted advisor to important stakeholders - your contribution will create a significant impact on the client’s successWorking directly with the client - no middle management involvedA clear focus on digital sales, in both B2C and B2BYou'll have the best people to work with and learn from in a truly flat organisationA diverse and inclusive workplaceParticipating in account management and framing our sales offering, should you be interestedOpportunities to join competency specific task forces, such as HR, recruitment, and competency development, depending on your career goalsRequirementsBroad experience in building web servicesExperience in building web services and familiarity with both frontend and backend development. Your focus can be more on the frontend, backend or broader systems but you aren’t afraid to jump in at any point. Languages familiar to you could include e.g. JavaScript (and frameworks such as React, Angular, or Vue.js), Scala, Go, Python, Java, or PHP. Understanding of the entire web development process (design, development, deployment, operations)Great communication skillsAnalytical mindset and problem-solving skillsPast experience in consulting or digital commerce would be very valuable but is not necessaryCompensation 54 000 - 90 000 €/year depending on your professional skillset and the level of seniority.Recruitment processThe recruitment process usually has 1-3 steps during which we get to know who you are and what motivates you. You will learn more about Columbia Road and get to meet different people from our company. You'll have the opportunity to present highlights from your career and tell us about your skills, roles, and learnings.We’re committed to creating a good match between you and our organisation, and want to spend time to get it right. Sometimes, an assignment might be given to you to complete between interviews.When we’re done with the face-to-face discussions, we’ll contact the people you have chosen as references.We hope to hear from you soon!BenefitsAs a Columbia Road employee, you have the option to buy stocks of the company through the common employee share programA yearly bonus based on company performance (equal to all full-time Roadies)Brick-n-mortar office in downtown Helsinki and flexible remote workingEven in a hybrid work environment, we create new ways to interact with other Roadies; exclusive exercise and outdoor activities, breakfasts at our Eteläesplanadi office, and remote workspaces for individual teams are a few examples of thisLunch benefitPhone benefitPick the laptop and phone of your choosingHealth care & service, including dental and mental healthChildcare services when your child falls illInsurance for travel and free-timeRecurring training & learning sessionsWellness and personal development (tools, events, etc.) reimbursementWeekly breakfasts & healthy daily refreshmentsSports, culture, massage & commute vouchersBike benefitCompany-wide excursion trips Option to have housing as a part of total compensation (tax-deductible)Compensation for working on open source or social programs in your free timeCurrently, we have over 20 nationalities working in the company and the official language is English. As a web analytics consultant in Columbia Road’s Tampere team, you will be working in a high-impact role in the core of our clients’ businesses. You’ll have an integral role in building the Tampere team, your contribution will have a significant influence on our local operations.As a web analytics consultant, you’ll be building sustainable digital sales ecommerce & channel strategies for our customers and challenging their thinking. You are able to analyse root causes of their current state and propose improvements; this means also understanding and analysing their technology environment, processes, organisation and governance models. You will be in a key role in helping our customers grow their business.You understand digital business on all levels; from analytics and technology stack to all touchpoints along the customer journey. Besides presenting the outcomes of your analysis to clients, you are using these insights to continuously test hypotheses and tactics with real customers and optimising business operations. All of our consultants are working very hands-on. We are a flat organization and we don’t have any managerial positions. This is a great opportunity for you if you are looking to become an expert within the area of digital sales and expand your technical skills and know-how within – and beyond if you like, – the Salesforce ecosystem.Your job is to create business impact by helping our clients utilise the capabilities of the Salesforce ecosystem to the fullest. You automate business processes and develop and enhance existing solutions that are at the forefront of our clients business. You strive to be a full-stack Salesforce developer, even though your current skills might lean more towards backend or frontend development. You know the core Salesforce setup and configuration capabilities well enough to evaluate when custom development is really needed.Columbia Road's focus on digital sales means that we are tackling a large variety of projects. These range from Experience Cloud and customer 360 data platform projects to Sales and Service Clouds, CPQ and various integrations, where the Salesforce ecosystem is a key enabler. For a few concrete examples of our relevant cases, take a look at the Framery case of a new partner sales and collaboration channel and full business platform build project for Valokuitunen.We work as diverse teams of digital sales experts, tailored to each project. In most of your projects, you will get to work closely with business designers defining which processes to automate and UI/UX designers to build world-class user and customer-facing experiences. As we believe that best results arise from employee freedom, all teams have wide latitude to choose the best tools and ways of working for themselves. We expect you to be mostly into the Salesforce ecosystem while we hope that you want to grow into a Roadie who can recognise where other solutions might be a better fit.At Columbia Road, we approach projects from a tech agnostic perspective, choosing the technologies that best suit our clients' needs. Depending on your career goals, you can continue deepening your skillset with Salesforce or expand your know-how to other programming languages, technologies, and platforms as well. We see this as a great opportunity for professional growth and are looking for colleagues who also value this. The more experience you have, the more you'll be able to take responsibility for your client projects and help other Roadies grow as well.As our Tampere team is still fairly new, an interest in contributing to areas such as recruitment, sales, supporting others and building the Columbia Road culture is highly valued.Professional Benefits For YouA high-impact role as a trusted advisor to important stakeholders - your contribution will create a significant impact on the client’s and Columbia Road’s successOpportunity to have an integral part in our Tampere operationsParticipating in account management and framing our sales offering, should you be interestedWorking directly with the client - no middle management involvedA clear focus on digital sales, in both B2C and B2BYou'll have the best people to work with and learn from in a truly flat organisationA diverse and inclusive workplaceRequirementsUnderstanding of Salesforce’s setup and configuration capabilities and having hands-on experience in one or more of Salesforce clouds such as Sales, Service or Experience CloudHighly skilled in APEX and SOQL. Know-how in Lightning web components, in addition, is considered a great asset. Great communication and problem-solving skills and an analytical mindsetFamiliarity with modern web-programming languages is considered a plus (such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, AJAX or similar other technologies)Past experience in consulting, digital commerce or around sales and marketing processes is valued but not requiredYou are authorized to work in Finland or Sweden. Unfortunately, we are currently not able to support with relocationRecruitment processThe recruitment process usually has 1-3 steps during which we get to know who you are and what motivates you. You will learn more about Columbia Road and get to meet different people from our company. You'll have the opportunity to present highlights from your career and tell us about your skills, roles, and learnings.We’re committed to creating a good match between you and our organisation, and want to spend time to get it right. Sometimes, an assignment might be given to you to complete between interviews.When we’re done with the face-to-face discussions, we’ll contact the people you have chosen as references.We hope to hear from you soon!BenefitsAs a Columbia Road employee, you have the option to buy stocks of the company through the common employee share programA yearly bonus based on company performance (equal to all full-time Roadies)Flexible remote working and a shared office with Futurice in Tampella + brick-n-mortar office in downtown HelsinkiEven in a hybrid work environment, we create new ways to interact with other Roadies; exclusive exercise and outdoor activities and remote workspaces for individual teams are a few examples of this.Lunch benefitPhone benefitPick the laptop and phone of your choosingHealth care & service, including dental and mental healthChildcare services when your child falls illInsurance for travel and free-timeRecurring training & learning sessionsWellness and personal development (tools, events, etc.) reimbursementWeekly breakfasts & healthy daily refreshmentsSports, culture & massage vouchersBike benefitCompany-wide excursion tripsOption to have housing as a part of total compensation (tax-deductible)Compensation for working on open source or social programs in your free time

Ready to start the next chapter in your career journey? You’re in the right place. We’re always happy to hear from people who are eager to learn and grow, and share our values. Welcome home.We're looking for Tech Lead/ArchitectTech Lead's / Architects at Futurice are generalists working across industries to help clients solve their important challenges in business and technology. They work with digital services, software development and improving how digital is done in big organizations. They have a wide understanding of technology and a toolset of modern frameworks and methodologies. Tech Lead's/Architects often have years of experience in software development but have extended the scope of problems to tackle as they also want to see the impact being made to organizational issues. Here are some examples of our expertise:DevOps & Cloud architectureSolid experience with AWS, Google Cloud and/or Microsoft AzureDesigning for Single Cloud provider or Hybrid Cloud scenariosDeveloping complex scenarios using cloud agnostic stacksSecurity architectureFacilitating Threat Modeling & Risk Management workshopsSecurity Auditing and recommending code pipeline best practicesAI & Data architectureBuilding Data Lake and Data Warehousing solutions in the CloudAnalytics, Visualizations and Business Intelligence systems (e.g. Splunk, Kibana, PowerBI, QlikView, QuickSight, Data Studio, etc)AI/Machine Learning model creation and training (e.g. Tensorflow, Apache MXNet)Additionally, you will take a significant role in shaping the architecture team and contributing to our company thought leadership efforts. Due to the exploratory nature of this role, you will also assist in account management and sales related activities.Are you our new colleague?You have a broad knowledge of tools, frameworks and technologies related to designing, implementing, deploying and hosting software services.Solid experience in at least one of the following Architecture domains: DevOps & Cloud, Security and/or Data & AIStrong expertise in agile software development and methods (e.g. Scrum, Kanban).You have experience in designing and implementing modern REST-based APIs, using e.g. Java, Scala, or Node.js.You have a good understanding of both relational databases as well as no-SQL databases.Good leadership skills in achieving momentum, action and resultsAbility to ask the right questions and drive troubleshooting with expertsThought leader and influencer: public speaking, tech articles, etc.Willingness to take a step in the abstraction level to solve organizational issues and drive towards results in big projects.Ability to work in diverse work cultures and comfortable with nonhierarchical organizations.Fluent English is required, Finnish skills is a plus.If you get good vibes after reading this, we would love to hear from you!Please check the application form behind the link to show your interest and tell us a bit about your career background and why you are motivated to become part of the Futu family.

As a Data Engineer you get a deep-dive into clients’ data!We hope you are ready to get your hands dirty with designing, building, automating and operating data platforms and data pipelines. It’s all about putting your mind into automating infrastructure, monitoring and recovery routines. Overall, the key is being curious, solving problems and recognising how to interact with different types of data and people. All the work we do is about helping and guiding our clients, so having a true consultant mindset and interest in supporting sales is what we value dearly.In our work as consultants we give high fives to agile ways of working and the importance of transparency and trust in teamwork. As a Data Engineer you have talented professionals around you such as data scientists, software developers, designers and of course our clients and their end-users. You will work with a variety of projects, domains and business cases; Lately, we have been working with data architecture of a media company, building a real-time chat spam detector for a gaming company, and making data more accessible on a governmental organization.Here are some practical things we’d love to see in your back pocketExperience on data stack on AWS (e.g. RedShift, Glue, Athena) or on Azure (e.g. Data Factory, Synapse, Databricks)Strong know-how on building, deploying and orchestrating data infrastructure (e.g. serverless computation, Sagemaker, CI tools, Terraform, or similar tools). You have a dev-ops oriented mindset.An excellent understanding of databases. Relational databases are most often used, but many projects also employ document databases, key-value stores, and related technologies.Practical software experience from a variety of projects. Python or Java experience is on top of our list right now, but other languages are definitely considered as a plus too!Appreciation for a good communication with both the team and the clients. You are fluent at least in English and hopefully also in Finnish.We offer you the Ultimate Learning PlatformWith us you get the opportunity to work with the most motivated and multi talented forces in development, design and strategy. As an agency, we have a versatile portfolio of projects and we solve different kinds of problems that require different kinds of tools – for you this means the chance of a lifetime to follow your learning goals and broaden your skill set. You will be inspired and supported throughout your journey as our aspiration is to be the Ultimate Learning Platform for your career. We are a people-first-company and believe that at the end of the day happy people are the key to great software and happy clients.If you get good vibes after reading this, we would love to hear from you!Please check the application form behind the link to show your interest and tell us a bit about your career background and why you are motivated to become part of the Futu family.

We are looking for a CRM consultant who wants to create a measurable business impact for our clients. You'll define, build and optimise CRM and customer data solutions that drive lead generation, sales growth, customer service experience, and customer loyalty.Who We AreColumbia Road builds seamless and commercially effective customer journeys that create impact. We help our clients get more revenue and more customers, but also to sell better. Our tight-knit team consists of business consultants who understand software and of highly talented business-driven design and technology specialists.Currently, we have over 20 nationalities working in the company and the official language is English. Our company spirit is one of a true start-up, but with a twist of hard-core experience. We believe in giving a lot of responsibility and freedom to our employees. Diversity, equity, and inclusion are at the heart of our essence and everyone at Columbia Road is committed to these values.Columbia Road has grown from 0 to over 150 exceptionally talented people in 6 years and in two countries. We are proud of the high customer satisfaction we have achieved as a result of focusing on people and creating concrete, measurable business impact for our clients every day.Take a look at our Culture Code to get to know us better. We come 100% recommended on Glassdoor with a 4.8/5 score.Columbia Road is a part of the Futurice family of companies.The Job & What You’d Be Working OnWe are looking for a CRM consultant who has an innovative mindset towards generating growth. You will be in a key role in helping our clients grow their business. We can see a clear rise in the demand of CRM specific expertise with our clients which translates into exciting growth opportunities for you. Columbia Road is a great place to acquire a broad expertise of various business areas.As a CRM consultant, you'll define, build and optimise CRM and customer data solutions that drive lead generation, sales growth, customer service experience, and customer loyalty. For example, you can bring marketing and sales closer together by creating automated, data-driven sales practices and solutions, or digital services for customers and partners.You are familiar with tapping into customer data and enabling data-driven marketing, sales, and service processes. You are endlessly driving to improve the customer experience at all stages of the customer journey.We expect you to have extensive hands-on experience from implementing and operating one or more CRM tools, and to have an understanding of customer journeys and processes that drive those great customer experiences.By nature, you are analytical and like to solve problems. You are able to bring clarity to uncertain and hectic situations. You are ambitious and results-oriented in everything you do, but you like to have fun as well.At Columbia Road, we believe that marketing and sales should be a joint effort. Marketing is not an add-on, it’s at the core of digital sales. Digital marketers and CRM experts should be working together developing digital sales. We’re committed to making a change in our field.RequirementsSkills and experience we expect you to have:Hands-on implementation and operational experience in CRM tools, for example, Salesforce, HubSpot, Microsoft Dynamics, Pipedrive, or other CRM solutionsAnalytical and curious mindset, ability to see outside the boxAbility to quickly identify business challenges and opportunities, and create an actionable plan for solving themAbility to communicate clearly about complex issues to C Suite level audiences as well as to technical teamsAbility to use customer data from various sources, for example CRMs, CDPs, marketing automation systems, and/or DMPsInterest in digital sales technologies and understanding also the technical side of toolsLanguage: professional proficiency in EnglishAdditionally, we highly value any relevant additional skills, such as:Marketing Automation platforms, for example, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Hubspot, Pardot, Marketo, Eloqua, Exponea/Bloomreach, and/or Customer.ioFront-end development, e.g. HTML, CSS, and/or JavaScriptService-, UX-, and/or graphic designSales developmentAnalytics and business intelligenceMake sure you showcase your experience and knowledge as clearly as possible in your application, resume, and possible other attachments. We value examples and results from previous projects, and we'd love to know what concrete tools you used to get those results.Recruitment processThe recruitment process usually has 1-3 steps during which we get to know who you are and what motivates you. You will learn more about Columbia Road and get to meet different people from our company. You'll have the opportunity to present highlights from your career and tell us about your skills, roles, and learnings.We’re committed to creating a good match between you and our organisation, and want to spend time to get it right. Sometimes, an assignment might be given to you to complete between interviews. When we’re done with the face-to-face discussions, we’ll contact the people you have chosen as references.We hope to hear from you soon!PLEASE NOTE: We are currently not able to offer this position to anyone who does not have a valid working visa in Finland or an EU citizenship that allows you to work in EU countries.BenefitsA community-led organization with a high level of autonomyAs a Columbia Road employee, you have the option to buy stocks of the company through the common employee share programA yearly bonus based on company performance (equal to all full-time Roadies)Recurring training and learning sessions to support your professional growthA diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplaceOffices in downtown Helsinki (with gym and pool) and TamperePick the laptop, phone, and digital tools of your choosingExtensive health care services, including dental and mental healthInsurance for travel and free-timeLunch benefitPhone benefitWeekly breakfasts and healthy daily refreshmentsFlexible vouchers for sports, culture, commuting, and massageOption to have housing as a part of total compensationOption to have a bicycle salary alternative as a part of total compensationRecurring Roadie-ideated events and activitiesChildcare services when your child falls illCompensation for working on open source or social programs in your free time

Diversity, equity, and inclusion are at the heart of our essence and everyone at Columbia Road is committed to these values.Columbia Road has grown from 0 to over 140 exceptionally talented people in 6 years and in two countries. We are proud of the high customer satisfaction we have achieved as a result of focusing on people and creating concrete, measurable business impact for our clients every day.Take a look at our Culture Code & People to get to know us better. We come 100% recommended on Glassdoor with a 4.8/5 score. Diversity, equity and inclusion are at the heart of our essence and everyone at Columbia Road is committed to these values.Columbia Road is a part of the Futurice family of companies.Job DescriptionWe are now recruiting in Tampere for the first time ever, and we have ambitious business goals in the area (we always do). As a Salesforce developer in Columbia Road’s Tampere team, you will be working in a high-impact role in the core of our clients’ businesses. You’ll have an integral role in building the Tampere team, your contribution will have a significant influence on our local operations.As a consultant at Columbia Road, you will be working in the core of our clients’ businesses; advising, designing and implementing the tech needed to drive the business forward. This is a great opportunity for you if you are looking to become an expert within the area of digital sales and expand your technical skills and know-how within – and beyond if you like, – the Salesforce ecosystem.Your job is to create business impact by helping our clients utilise the capabilities of the Salesforce ecosystem to the fullest. You automate business processes and develop and enhance existing solutions that are at the forefront of our clients business. You strive to be a full-stack Salesforce developer, even though your current skills might lean more towards backend or frontend development. You know the core Salesforce setup and configuration capabilities well enough to evaluate when custom development is really needed.Columbia Road's focus on digital sales means that we are tackling a large variety of projects. These range from Experience Cloud and customer 360 data platform projects to Sales and Service Clouds, CPQ and various integrations, where the Salesforce ecosystem is a key enabler. For a few concrete examples of our relevant cases, take a look at the Framery case of a new partner sales and collaboration channel and full business platform build project for Valokuitunen.We work as diverse teams of digital sales experts, tailored to each project. In most of your projects, you will get to work closely with business designers defining which processes to automate and UI/UX designers to build world-class user and customer-facing experiences. As we believe that best results arise from employee freedom, all teams have wide latitude to choose the best tools and ways of working for themselves. We expect you to be mostly into the Salesforce ecosystem while we hope that you want to grow into a Roadie who can recognise where other solutions might be a better fit.At Columbia Road, we approach projects from a tech agnostic perspective, choosing the technologies that best suit our clients' needs. Depending on your career goals, you can continue deepening your skillset with Salesforce or expand your know-how to other programming languages, technologies, and platforms as well. We see this as a great opportunity for professional growth and are looking for colleagues who also value this. The more experience you have, the more you'll be able to take responsibility for your client projects and help other Roadies grow as well.As our Tampere team is still fairly new, an interest in contributing to areas such as recruitment, sales, supporting others and building the Columbia Road culture is highly valued.Professional Benefits For YouA high-impact role as a trusted advisor to important stakeholders - your contribution will create a significant impact on the client’s and Columbia Road’s successOpportunity to have an integral part in our Tampere operationsParticipating in account management and framing our sales offering, should you be interestedWorking directly with the client - no middle management involvedA clear focus on digital sales, in both B2C and B2BYou'll have the best people to work with and learn from in a truly flat organisationA diverse and inclusive workplaceRequirementsUnderstanding of Salesforce’s setup and configuration capabilities and having hands-on experience in one or more of Salesforce clouds such as Sales, Service or Experience CloudHighly skilled in APEX and SOQL. Know-how in Lightning web components, in addition, is considered a great asset. Great communication and problem-solving skills and an analytical mindsetFamiliarity with modern web-programming languages is considered a plus (such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, AJAX or similar other technologies)Past experience in consulting, digital commerce or around sales and marketing processes is valued but not requiredYou are authorized to work in Finland or Sweden. Unfortunately, we are currently not able to support with relocationRecruitment processThe recruitment process usually has 1-3 steps during which we get to know who you are and what motivates you. You will learn more about Columbia Road and get to meet different people from our company. You'll have the opportunity to present highlights from your career and tell us about your skills, roles, and learnings.We’re committed to creating a good match between you and our organisation, and want to spend time to get it right. Sometimes, an assignment might be given to you to complete between interviews.When we’re done with the face-to-face discussions, we’ll contact the people you have chosen as references.We hope to hear from you soon!BenefitsAs a Columbia Road employee, you have the option to buy stocks of the company through the common employee share programA yearly bonus based on company performance (equal to all full-time Roadies)Flexible remote working and a shared office with Futurice in Tampella + brick-n-mortar office in downtown HelsinkiEven in a hybrid work environment, we create new ways to interact with other Roadies; exclusive exercise and outdoor activities and remote workspaces for individual teams are a few examples of this.Lunch benefitPhone benefitPick the laptop and phone of your choosingHealth care & service, including dental and mental healthChildcare services when your child falls illInsurance for travel and free-timeRecurring training & learning sessionsWellness and personal development (tools, events, etc.) reimbursementWeekly breakfasts & healthy daily refreshmentsSports, culture & massage vouchersBike benefitCompany-wide excursion tripsOption to have housing as a part of total compensation (tax-deductible)Compensation for working on open source or social programs in your free time

Ready to start the next chapter in your career journey? You’re in the right place. We’re always happy to hear from people who are eager to learn and grow, and share our values. Welcome home.We're looking for Tech Lead/ArchitectTech Lead's / Architects at Futurice are generalists working across industries to help clients solve their important challenges in business and technology. They work with digital services, software development and improving how digital is done in big organizations. They have a wide understanding of technology and a toolset of modern frameworks and methodologies. Tech Lead's/Architects often have years of experience in software development but have extended the scope of problems to tackle as they also want to see the impact being made to organizational issues. Here are some examples of our expertise:DevOps & Cloud architectureSolid experience with AWS, Google Cloud and/or Microsoft AzureDesigning for Single Cloud provider or Hybrid Cloud scenariosDeveloping complex scenarios using cloud agnostic stacksSecurity architectureFacilitating Threat Modeling & Risk Management workshopsSecurity Auditing and recommending code pipeline best practicesAI & Data architectureBuilding Data Lake and Data Warehousing solutions in the CloudAnalytics, Visualizations and Business Intelligence systems (e.g. Splunk, Kibana, PowerBI, QlikView, QuickSight, Data Studio, etc)AI/Machine Learning model creation and training (e.g. Tensorflow, Apache MXNet)Additionally, you will take a significant role in shaping the architecture team and contributing to our company thought leadership efforts. Due to the exploratory nature of this role, you will also assist in account management and sales related activities.Are you our new colleague?You have a broad knowledge of tools, frameworks and technologies related to designing, implementing, deploying and hosting software services.Solid experience in at least one of the following Architecture domains: DevOps & Cloud, Security and/or Data & AIStrong expertise in agile software development and methods (e.g. Scrum, Kanban).You have experience in designing and implementing modern REST-based APIs, using e.g. Java, Scala, or Node.js.You have a good understanding of both relational databases as well as no-SQL databases.Good leadership skills in achieving momentum, action and resultsAbility to ask the right questions and drive troubleshooting with expertsThought leader and influencer: public speaking, tech articles, etc.Willingness to take a step in the abstraction level to solve organizational issues and drive towards results in big projects.Ability to work in diverse work cultures and comfortable with nonhierarchical organizations.Fluent English is required, Finnish skills is a plus.If you get good vibes after reading this, we would love to hear from you!Please check the application form behind the link to show your interest and tell us a bit about your career background and why you are motivated to become part of the Futu family.

As a Data Engineer you get a deep-dive into clients’ data!We hope you are ready to get your hands dirty with designing, building, automating and operating data platforms and data pipelines. It’s all about putting your mind into automating infrastructure, monitoring and recovery routines. Overall, the key is being curious, solving problems and recognising how to interact with different types of data and people. All the work we do is about helping and guiding our clients, so having a true consultant mindset and interest in supporting sales is what we value dearly.In our work as consultants we give high fives to agile ways of working and the importance of transparency and trust in teamwork. As a Data Engineer you have talented professionals around you such as data scientists, software developers, designers and of course our clients and their end-users. You will work with a variety of projects, domains and business cases; Lately, we have been working with data architecture of a media company, building a real-time chat spam detector for a gaming company, and making data more accessible on a governmental organization.Here are some practical things we’d love to see in your back pocketExperience on data stack on AWS (e.g. RedShift, Glue, Athena) or on Azure (e.g. Data Factory, Synapse, Databricks)Strong know-how on building, deploying and orchestrating data infrastructure (e.g. serverless computation, Sagemaker, CI tools, Terraform, or similar tools). You have a dev-ops oriented mindset.An excellent understanding of databases. Relational databases are most often used, but many projects also employ document databases, key-value stores, and related technologies.Practical software experience from a variety of projects. Python or Java experience is on top of our list right now, but other languages are definitely considered as a plus too!Appreciation for a good communication with both the team and the clients. You are fluent at least in English and hopefully also in Finnish.We offer you the Ultimate Learning PlatformWith us you get the opportunity to work with the most motivated and multi talented forces in development, design and strategy. As an agency, we have a versatile portfolio of projects and we solve different kinds of problems that require different kinds of tools – for you this means the chance of a lifetime to follow your learning goals and broaden your skill set. You will be inspired and supported throughout your journey as our aspiration is to be the Ultimate Learning Platform for your career. We are a people-first-company and believe that at the end of the day happy people are the key to great software and happy clients.If you get good vibes after reading this, we would love to hear from you!Please check the application form behind the link to show your interest and tell us a bit about your career background and why you are motivated to become part of the Futu family.

We are looking for a CRM consultant who wants to create a measurable business impact for our clients. You'll define, build and optimise CRM and customer data solutions that drive lead generation, sales growth, customer service experience, and customer loyalty.Who We AreColumbia Road builds seamless and commercially effective customer journeys that create impact. We help our clients get more revenue and more customers, but also to sell better. Our tight-knit team consists of business consultants who understand software and of highly talented business-driven design and technology specialists.Currently, we have over 20 nationalities working in the company and the official language is English. Our company spirit is one of a true start-up, but with a twist of hard-core experience. We believe in giving a lot of responsibility and freedom to our employees. Diversity, equity, and inclusion are at the heart of our essence and everyone at Columbia Road is committed to these values.Columbia Road has grown from 0 to over 150 exceptionally talented people in 6 years and in two countries. We are proud of the high customer satisfaction we have achieved as a result of focusing on people and creating concrete, measurable business impact for our clients every day.Take a look at our Culture Code to get to know us better. We come 100% recommended on Glassdoor with a 4.8/5 score.Columbia Road is a part of the Futurice family of companies.The Job & What You’d Be Working OnWe are looking for a CRM consultant who has an innovative mindset towards generating growth. You will be in a key role in helping our clients grow their business. We can see a clear rise in the demand of CRM specific expertise with our clients which translates into exciting growth opportunities for you. Columbia Road is a great place to acquire a broad expertise of various business areas.As a CRM consultant, you'll define, build and optimise CRM and customer data solutions that drive lead generation, sales growth, customer service experience, and customer loyalty. For example, you can bring marketing and sales closer together by creating automated, data-driven sales practices and solutions, or digital services for customers and partners.You are familiar with tapping into customer data and enabling data-driven marketing, sales, and service processes. You are endlessly driving to improve the customer experience at all stages of the customer journey.We expect you to have extensive hands-on experience from implementing and operating one or more CRM tools, and to have an understanding of customer journeys and processes that drive those great customer experiences.By nature, you are analytical and like to solve problems. You are able to bring clarity to uncertain and hectic situations. You are ambitious and results-oriented in everything you do, but you like to have fun as well.At Columbia Road, we believe that marketing and sales should be a joint effort. Marketing is not an add-on, it’s at the core of digital sales. Digital marketers and CRM experts should be working together developing digital sales. We’re committed to making a change in our field.RequirementsSkills and experience we expect you to have:Hands-on implementation and operational experience in CRM tools, for example, Salesforce, HubSpot, Microsoft Dynamics, Pipedrive, or other CRM solutionsAnalytical and curious mindset, ability to see outside the boxAbility to quickly identify business challenges and opportunities, and create an actionable plan for solving themAbility to communicate clearly about complex issues to C Suite level audiences as well as to technical teamsAbility to use customer data from various sources, for example CRMs, CDPs, marketing automation systems, and/or DMPsInterest in digital sales technologies and understanding also the technical side of toolsLanguage: professional proficiency in EnglishAdditionally, we highly value any relevant additional skills, such as:Marketing Automation platforms, for example, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Hubspot, Pardot, Marketo, Eloqua, Exponea/Bloomreach, and/or Customer.ioFront-end development, e.g. HTML, CSS, and/or JavaScriptService-, UX-, and/or graphic designSales developmentAnalytics and business intelligenceMake sure you showcase your experience and knowledge as clearly as possible in your application, resume, and possible other attachments. We value examples and results from previous projects, and we'd love to know what concrete tools you used to get those results.Recruitment processThe recruitment process usually has 1-3 steps during which we get to know who you are and what motivates you. You will learn more about Columbia Road and get to meet different people from our company. You'll have the opportunity to present highlights from your career and tell us about your skills, roles, and learnings.We’re committed to creating a good match between you and our organisation, and want to spend time to get it right. Sometimes, an assignment might be given to you to complete between interviews. When we’re done with the face-to-face discussions, we’ll contact the people you have chosen as references.We hope to hear from you soon!PLEASE NOTE: We are currently not able to offer this position to anyone who does not have a valid working visa in Finland or an EU citizenship that allows you to work in EU countries.BenefitsA community-led organization with a high level of autonomyAs a Columbia Road employee, you have the option to buy stocks of the company through the common employee share programA yearly bonus based on company performance (equal to all full-time Roadies)Recurring training and learning sessions to support your professional growthA diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplaceOffices in downtown Helsinki (with gym and pool) and TamperePick the laptop, phone, and digital tools of your choosingExtensive health care services, including dental and mental healthInsurance for travel and free-timeLunch benefitPhone benefitWeekly breakfasts and healthy daily refreshmentsFlexible vouchers for sports, culture, commuting, and massageOption to have housing as a part of total compensationOption to have a bicycle salary alternative as a part of total compensationRecurring Roadie-ideated events and activitiesChildcare services when your child falls illCompensation for working on open source or social programs in your free time

We believe that technology is a tool that we need to master, but the actual business impact of the service is the first thing we want to understand and select proper tooling after that.Take a look at our Culture Code & People to get to know us better. We come 100% recommended on Glassdoor with a 4.8/5 score. Diversity, equity and inclusion are at the heart of our essence and everyone at Columbia Road is committed to these values.Columbia Road is a part of the Futurice family of companies.The Job & What You’d Be Working OnWe are now recruiting in Tampere for the first time ever, and we have ambitious business goals in the area (we always do). We are looking for senior software developers who are motivated by working on software that has a measurable impact on business.As a senior software consultant in Columbia Road’s Tampere team, you will be working in a high-impact role in the core of our clients’ businesses:You’ll code, build storefronts, and work with APIs and integrations You’ll advise, design, and implement the tech needed to drive business results forwardYou’ll be a trusted advisor and a sparring partner to important client stakeholdersYour contribution will have a significant effect on the client’s successYou’ll have an integral role in building the Tampere team, your contribution will have a significant impact on our local operations.Roadies work as diverse teams of digital sales experts, tailored to each project. The more experience you have, the more you'll be able to take responsibility for your client projects and coach other Roadies. You’d often be responsible for the completion of a challenging project or activities in which you take ownership of a team.As our Tampere team is still fairly new, an interest in contributing to areas such as recruitment, technical sales, supporting others and building the Columbia Road culture is highly valued.Columbia Road’s focus on digital sales still means that we are tackling a large variety of projects ranging from ecommerce platforms and data platform projects to site optimisation and mobile development. To mention a few:We help Elisa run modern online sales in a fully integrated teamWe’re helping Vahterus on their digital sales transformation journeyWe’re working with Posti on a scalable ecommerce platform.Our ways of workingAs we believe that best results arise from employee freedom, all teams have wide latitude to choose the best tools and ways of working for themselves and the people in the client organisation. Even as your focus is likely on some part of the stack (frontend, backend, integrations or other), we value people who aren’t too afraid to get their hands dirty with the other areas when necessary.All of our consultants work directly with client stakeholders to build a good understanding of their business and its challenges. While development is probably where most of your time goes, we are in the business of creating impact for our clients, and that means spending some time to understand how the business functions.We help our clients in translating business opportunities into actionable plans and concrete solutions. Read more about how we code and design high performing digital sales channels. When it comes to remote versus on-site, we are flexible and always work according to what’s best for our clients - we hope that you can commit to spending at least a few days a week at our client’s premises.We offer a wide range of learning opportunities as continuous learning is one of our core values, therefore you will be offered various learning opportunities in your daily work as well as internal learning events, training, and meetups to share and enlarge your knowledge.Professional Benefits For YouA high-impact role as a trusted advisor to important stakeholders - your contribution will create a significant impact on the client’s and Columbia Road’s successOpportunity to have an integral part in our Tampere operationsParticipating in account management and framing our sales offering, should you be interestedOpportunities to join competency specific task forces, such as HR, recruitment, and competency development, depending on your career goalsWorking directly with the client - no middle management involvedA clear focus on digital sales, in both B2C and B2BYou'll have the best people to work with and learn from in a truly flat organisationA diverse and inclusive workplaceRequirementsBroad experience in building web servicesExperience in building web services and familiarity with both frontend and backend development. Your focus can be more on the frontend, backend or broader systems but you aren’t afraid to jump in at any point. Languages familiar to you could include e.g. JavaScript (and frameworks such as React, Angular, or Vue.js), Scala, Go, Python, Java, or PHP. Understanding of the entire web development process (design, development, deployment, operations)Great communication skillsAnalytical mindset and problem-solving skillsPast experience in consulting or digital commerce would be very valuable but is not necessaryCompensation 54 000 - 90 000 €/year depending on your professional skillset and the level of seniority.Recruitment processThe recruitment process usually has 1-3 steps during which we get to know who you are and what motivates you. You will learn more about Columbia Road and get to meet different people from our company. You'll have the opportunity to present highlights from your career and tell us about your skills, roles, and learnings.We’re committed to creating a good match between you and our organisation, and want to spend time to get it right. As a marketing automation consultant, you'll be working on planning and executing successful marketing automation activities, such as lead acquisition, nurturing, upselling, and customer activation. Who We AreColumbia Road builds seamless and commercially effective customer journeys that create impact. We help our clients get more revenue and more customers, but also to sell better. Our tight-knit team consists of business consultants who understand software and of highly talented business-driven design and technology specialists.Currently, we have over 20 nationalities working in the company and the official language is English. Our company spirit is one of a true start-up, but with a twist of hard-core experience. We believe in giving a lot of responsibility and freedom to our employees. Diversity, equity, and inclusion are at the heart of our essence and everyone at Columbia Road is committed to these values.Columbia Road has grown from 0 to over 140 exceptionally talented people in 6 years and in two countries. We are proud of the high customer satisfaction we have achieved as a result of focusing on people and creating concrete, measurable business impact for our clients every day.Take a look at our Culture Code & People to get to know us better. We come 100% recommended on Glassdoor with a 4.8/5 score. Diversity, equity and inclusion are at the heart of our essence and everyone at Columbia Road is committed to these values.Columbia Road is a part of the Futurice family of companies.Job DescriptionWe are now recruiting in Tampere for the first time ever, and we have ambitious business goals in the area (we always do). As a marketing automation consultant in Columbia Road’s Tampere team, you will be working in a high-impact role in the core of our clients’ businesses. You’ll have an integral role in building the Tampere team, your contribution will have a significant influence on our local operations.At Columbia Road, we believe that marketing and sales should be a joint effort. Marketing is not an add-on, it’s at the core of digital sales. Digital marketers should be working right there with the team developing digital sales. We’re committed to making a change in our field.We are looking for marketing automation consultants who have an innovative mindset towards generating growth. You will be in a key role in helping our customers grow their business.As a marketing automation consultant, you are used to planning and executing successful marketing automation activities, such as lead acquisition, nurturing, upselling, and customer activation.We expect you to have extensive hands-on experience from implementing and operating one or more marketing automation tools, and to have an understanding of customer journeys and nurturing campaigns.You are familiar with customer data analytics operations and are able to derive business insights from complex data, while endlessly driving to improve the customer experience at all stages of the customer journey.By nature, you are analytical and like to solve problems. You are able to bring clarity to uncertain and chaotic situations. You are ambitious and results-oriented in everything you do, but you like to have fun as well.In order to be successful in this role, we require you to have professional proficiency in written and spoken Finnish and English. In this job, you may need to write and manage content for Finnish speaking audiences.As our Tampere team is still fairly new, an interest in contributing to areas such as recruitment, sales, supporting others and building the Columbia Road culture is highly valued.Professional Benefits For YouA high-impact role as a trusted advisor to important stakeholders - your contribution will create a significant impact on the client’s and Columbia Road’s successOpportunity to have an integral part in our Tampere operationsParticipating in account management and framing our sales offering, should you be interestedWorking directly with the client - no middle management involvedA clear focus on digital sales, in both B2C and B2BYou'll have the best people to work with and learn from in a truly flat organisationA diverse and inclusive workplaceRequirementsSkills and experience we expect you to have:Analytical and curious mindset, ability to see outside the boxAbility to quickly identify business challenges and opportunities, and create an actionable plan for solving themAbility to communicate clearly about complex issues to C Suite level audiences as well as to technical teamsHands-on implementation and operational experience in Marketing Automation platforms, for example, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Hubspot, Pardot, Marketo, Eloqua, Exponea/Bloomreach, and/or Customer.ioUtilising customer data from various sources, e.g. CRMs, CDPs, and/or DMPsInterest in web technologies and understanding also the technical side of toolsLanguages: working proficiency Finnish and EnglishAdditionally, we highly value any relevant additional skills, such as:CRM tools, e.g. Salesforce, HubSpot, Pipedrive, and/or MS DynamicsDigital advertising, e.g. Google Ads, Facebook Ads Manager, and/or AdformSEO, content and technicalTag management, e.g. Google Tag ManagerCRO and/or A/B testingFront-end development, e.g. HTML, CSS and/or JavaScriptService-, UX-, and/or graphic designCopywritingSales developmentMake sure you showcase your experience and knowledge as clearly as possible in your application, resume, and possible other attachments. We value examples and results from previous projects, and we'd love to know what concrete tools you used to get those results.Recruitment processThe recruitment process usually has 1-3 steps during which we get to know who you are and what motivates you. You will learn more about Columbia Road and get to meet different people from our company. You'll have the opportunity to present highlights from your career and tell us about your skills, roles, and learnings.We’re committed to creating a good match between you and our organisation, and want to spend time to get it right. Sometimes, an assignment might be given to you to complete between interviews.When we’re done with the face-to-face discussions, we’ll contact the people you have chosen as references.We hope to hear from you soon!BenefitsAs a Columbia Road employee, you have the option to buy stocks of the company through the common employee share programA yearly bonus based on company performance (equal to all full-time Roadies)Flexible remote working and a shared office with Futurice in Tampella + brick-n-mortar office in downtown HelsinkiEven in a hybrid work environment, we create new ways to interact with other Roadies; exclusive exercise and outdoor activities and remote workspaces for individual teams are a few examples of this.Lunch benefitPhone benefitPick the laptop and phone of your choosingHealth care & service, including dental and mental healthChildcare services when your child falls illInsurance for travel and free-timeRecurring training & learning sessionsWellness and personal development (tools, events, etc.) reimbursementWeekly breakfasts & healthy daily refreshmentsSports, culture & massage vouchersBike benefitCompany-wide excursion tripsOption to have housing as a part of total compensation (tax-deductible) Compensation for working on open source or social programs in your free time

Columbia Road is a great place to acquire a broad expertise of various business areas.As a CRM consultant, you'll define, build and optimise CRM and customer data solutions that drive lead generation, sales growth, customer service experience, and customer loyalty. We are now recruiting senior software developers in Tampere, and are looking for people who are excited about building world-class digital sales software.Who We AreColumbia Road builds seamless and commercially effective customer journeys that create impact. We help our clients get more revenue and more customers, but also to sell better. Our tight-knit team consists of business consultants who understand software and of highly talented business-driven design and technology specialists. We believe that technology is a tool that we need to master, but the actual business impact of the service is the first thing we want to understand and select proper tooling after that.Take a look at our Culture Code & People to get to know us better. We come 100% recommended on Glassdoor with a 4.8/5 score. Diversity, equity and inclusion are at the heart of our essence and everyone at Columbia Road is committed to these values.Columbia Road is a part of the Futurice family of companies.The Job & What You’d Be Working OnWe are now recruiting in Tampere for the first time ever, and we have ambitious business goals in the area (we always do). We are looking for senior software developers who are motivated by working on software that has a measurable impact on business.As a senior software consultant in Columbia Road’s Tampere team, you will be working in a high-impact role in the core of our clients’ businesses:You’ll code, build storefronts, and work with APIs and integrations You’ll advise, design, and implement the tech needed to drive business results forwardYou’ll be a trusted advisor and a sparring partner to important client stakeholdersYour contribution will have a significant effect on the client’s successYou’ll have an integral role in building the Tampere team, your contribution will have a significant impact on our local operations.Roadies work as diverse teams of digital sales experts, tailored to each project. The more experience you have, the more you'll be able to take responsibility for your client projects and coach other Roadies. You’d often be responsible for the completion of a challenging project or activities in which you take ownership of a team.As our Tampere team is still fairly new, an interest in contributing to areas such as recruitment, technical sales, supporting others and building the Columbia Road culture is highly valued.Columbia Road’s focus on digital sales still means that we are tackling a large variety of projects ranging from ecommerce platforms and data platform projects to site optimisation and mobile development. To mention a few:We help Elisa run modern online sales in a fully integrated teamWe’re helping Vahterus on their digital sales transformation journeyWe’re working with Posti on a scalable ecommerce platform.Our ways of workingAs we believe that best results arise from employee freedom, all teams have wide latitude to choose the best tools and ways of working for themselves and the people in the client organisation. Even as your focus is likely on some part of the stack (frontend, backend, integrations or other), we value people who aren’t too afraid to get their hands dirty with the other areas when necessary.All of our consultants work directly with client stakeholders to build a good understanding of their business and its challenges. While development is probably where most of your time goes, we are in the business of creating impact for our clients, and that means spending some time to understand how the business functions.We help our clients in translating business opportunities into actionable plans and concrete solutions. Read more about how we code and design high performing digital sales channels. When it comes to remote versus on-site, we are flexible and always work according to what’s best for our clients - we hope that you can commit to spending at least a few days a week at our client’s premises.We offer a wide range of learning opportunities as continuous learning is one of our core values, therefore you will be offered various learning opportunities in your daily work as well as internal learning events, training, and meetups to share and enlarge your knowledge.Professional Benefits For YouA high-impact role as a trusted advisor to important stakeholders - your contribution will create a significant impact on the client’s and Columbia Road’s successOpportunity to have an integral part in our Tampere operationsParticipating in account management and framing our sales offering, should you be interestedOpportunities to join competency specific task forces, such as HR, recruitment, and competency development, depending on your career goalsWorking directly with the client - no middle management involvedA clear focus on digital sales, in both B2C and B2BYou'll have the best people to work with and learn from in a truly flat organisationA diverse and inclusive workplaceRequirementsBroad experience in building web servicesExperience in building web services and familiarity with both frontend and backend development. Your focus can be more on the frontend, backend or broader systems but you aren’t afraid to jump in at any point. Languages familiar to you could include e.g. JavaScript (and frameworks such as React, Angular, or Vue.js), Scala, Go, Python, Java, or PHP. Understanding of the entire web development process (design, development, deployment, operations)Great communication skillsAnalytical mindset and problem-solving skillsPast experience in consulting or digital commerce would be very valuable but is not necessaryCompensation 54 000 - 90 000 €/year depending on your professional skillset and the level of seniority.Recruitment processThe recruitment process usually has 1-3 steps during which we get to know who you are and what motivates you. We are looking for Salesforce developers who are motivated by working on software that has a measurable impact on business. You get to work directly with our clients in highly autonomous teams where software, design, and marketing come together.About Columbia RoadColumbia Road builds seamless and commercially effective customer journeys that create impact. We help our clients get more revenue and more customers, but also to sell better. Our tight-knit team consists of business consultants who understand software and of highly talented business-driven design and technology specialists.Currently, we have over 20 nationalities working in the company and the official language is English. Our company spirit is one of a true start-up, but with a twist of hard-core experience. We believe in giving a lot of responsibility and freedom to our employees. Diversity, equity, and inclusion are at the heart of our essence and everyone at Columbia Road is committed to these values.Columbia Road has grown from 0 to over 140 exceptionally talented people in 6 years and in two countries. We are proud of the high customer satisfaction we have achieved as a result of focusing on people and creating concrete, measurable business impact for our clients every day.Take a look at our Culture Code & People to get to know us better. We come 100% recommended on Glassdoor with a 4.8/5 score.Columbia Road is a part of the Futurice family of companies.Job DescriptionAs a consultant at Columbia Road, you will be working in the core of our clients’ businesses; advising, designing and implementing the tech needed to drive the business forward. This is a great opportunity for you if you are looking to become an expert within the area of digital sales and expand your technical skills and know-how within – and beyond if you like, – the Salesforce ecosystem.Your job is to create business impact by helping our clients utilise the capabilities of the Salesforce ecosystem to the fullest. You automate business processes and develop and enhance existing solutions that are at the forefront of our clients business. You strive to be a full-stack Salesforce developer, even though your current skills might lean more towards backend or frontend development. You know the core Salesforce setup and configuration capabilities well enough to evaluate when custom development is really needed.Columbia Road's focus on digital sales means that we are tackling a large variety of projects. These range from Experience Cloud and customer 360 data platform projects to Sales and Service Clouds, CPQ and various integrations, where the Salesforce ecosystem is a key enabler. For a few concrete examples of our relevant cases, take a look at the Framery case of a new partner sales and collaboration channel and full business platform build project for Valokuitunen.We work as diverse teams of digital sales experts, tailored to each project. In most of your projects, you will get to work closely with business designers defining which processes to automate and UI/UX designers to build world-class user and customer-facing experiences. As we believe that best results arise from employee freedom, all teams have wide latitude to choose the best tools and ways of working for themselves. We expect you to be mostly into the Salesforce ecosystem while we hope that you want to grow into a Roadie who can recognise where other solutions might be a better fit.At Columbia Road, we approach projects from a tech agnostic perspective, choosing the technologies that best suit our clients' needs. Depending on your career goals, you can continue deepening your skillset with Salesforce or expand your know-how to other programming languages, technologies, and platforms as well. We see this as a great opportunity for professional growth and are looking for colleagues who also value this. The more experience you have, the more you'll be able to take responsibility for your client projects and help other Roadies grow as well.RequirementsUnderstanding of Salesforce’s setup and configuration capabilities and having hands-on experience in one or more of Salesforce clouds such as Sales, Service or Experience CloudHighly skilled in APEX and SOQL. Know-how in Lightning web components, in addition, is considered a great asset. Great communication and problem-solving skills and an analytical mindsetFamiliarity with modern web-programming languages is considered a plus (such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, AJAX or similar other technologies)Past experience in consulting, digital commerce or around sales and marketing processes is valued but not requiredYou are authorized to work in Finland or Sweden. Unfortunately, we are currently not able to support with relocationRecruitment processThe recruitment process usually has 1-3 steps during which we get to know who you are and what motivates you. You will learn more about Columbia Road and get to meet different people from our company. You'll have the opportunity to present highlights from your career and tell us about your skills, roles, and learnings.We’re committed to creating a good match between you and our organisation, and want to spend time to get it right. Sometimes, an assignment might be given to you to complete between interviews.When we’re done with the face-to-face discussions, we’ll contact the people you have chosen as references.We hope to hear from you soon!BenefitsAs a Columbia Road employee, you have the option to buy stocks of the company through the common employee share programA yearly bonus based on company performance (equal to all full-time Roadies)Brick-n-mortar office in downtown Helsinki and flexible remote working.Even in a hybrid work environment, we create new ways to interact with other Roadies; exclusive exercise and outdoor activities, breakfasts at our Eteläesplanadi office, and remote workspaces for individual teams are a few examples of this.Lunch benefitPhone benefitPick the laptop and phone of your choosingHealth care & service, including dental and mental healthChildcare services when your child falls illInsurance for travel and free-timeRecurring training & learning sessionsWellness and personal development (tools, events, etc.) reimbursementWeekly breakfasts & healthy daily refreshmentsSports, culture, massage & commute vouchersBike benefitCompany-wide excursion tripsOption to have housing as a part of total compensation (tax-deductible)Compensation for working on open source or social programs in your free time

Ready to start the next chapter in your career journey? You’re in the right place. We’re always happy to hear from people who are eager to learn and grow, and share our values. Welcome home.We're looking for Tech Lead/ArchitectTech Lead's / Architects at Futurice are generalists working across industries to help clients solve their important challenges in business and technology. They work with digital services, software development and improving how digital is done in big organizations. They have a wide understanding of technology and a toolset of modern frameworks and methodologies. Tech Lead's/Architects often have years of experience in software development but have extended the scope of problems to tackle as they also want to see the impact being made to organizational issues. Here are some examples of our expertise:DevOps & Cloud architectureSolid experience with AWS, Google Cloud and/or Microsoft AzureDesigning for Single Cloud provider or Hybrid Cloud scenariosDeveloping complex scenarios using cloud agnostic stacksSecurity architectureFacilitating Threat Modeling & Risk Management workshopsSecurity Auditing and recommending code pipeline best practicesAI & Data architectureBuilding Data Lake and Data Warehousing solutions in the CloudAnalytics, Visualizations and Business Intelligence systems (e.g. Splunk, Kibana, PowerBI, QlikView, QuickSight, Data Studio, etc)AI/Machine Learning model creation and training (e.g. Tensorflow, Apache MXNet)Additionally, you will take a significant role in shaping the architecture team and contributing to our company thought leadership efforts. Due to the exploratory nature of this role, you will also assist in account management and sales related activities.Are you our new colleague?You have a broad knowledge of tools, frameworks and technologies related to designing, implementing, deploying and hosting software services.Solid experience in at least one of the following Architecture domains: DevOps & Cloud, Security and/or Data & AIStrong expertise in agile software development and methods (e.g. Scrum, Kanban).You have experience in designing and implementing modern REST-based APIs, using e.g. Java, Scala, or Node.js.You have a good understanding of both relational databases as well as no-SQL databases.Good leadership skills in achieving momentum, action and resultsAbility to ask the right questions and drive troubleshooting with expertsThought leader and influencer: public speaking, tech articles, etc.Willingness to take a step in the abstraction level to solve organizational issues and drive towards results in big projects.Ability to work in diverse work cultures and comfortable with nonhierarchical organizations.Fluent English is required, Finnish skills is a plus.If you get good vibes after reading this, we would love to hear from you!Please check the application form behind the link to show your interest and tell us a bit about your career background and why you are motivated to become part of the Futu family.
