The role of an Executive Assistant at CanonicalWe are a remote-first British tech company and are growing our team of Executive Assistants, who play a crucial role in the overall operation of the business and are the secret to our success! The Executive Assistant team run significant business operations and processes, supporting their respective leads but also taking central responsibility for logistics, expenses, travel and recruitment interview scheduling.We look for positive team players who are self-driven and results oriented, with excellent attention to detail. The best candidates can show that they are natural forward planners, are reliable and determined, and keen to assume responsibility for projects and processes. We are a unique global business, so we are not looking for candidates with extensive experience so much as excellent organisers and communicators who are keen to develop new skills and strive for continuous improvement.Location: this is a Globally remote role based in EMEA and AMER regionsWhat your day will look likeSupport one or more leads and their team(s)Schedule meetings and coordinate monthly reportsOrganise and run international team events including logisticsManage quarterly and annual executive meetingsWork with HR, Finance, and Legal as neededCollaborate on cross team activitiesManage suppliers and stakeholdersEstablish workflows and processesWhat we are looking for in youExperience in operations and executive supportExcellent communication skillsProject and event managementWillingness to travel up to 4 times a year for internal eventsIT skills including the entire G-suite (Gmail, Google docs and sheets etc.), ability to pick up new technology and software quickly. What we offer youYour base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, please ask your Talent Partner.Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annumAnnual compensation reviewRecognition rewardsAnnual holiday leaveParental LeaveEmployee Assistance ProgrammeOpportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company eventsAbout CanonicalCanonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.Canonical is an equal opportunity employerWe are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Canonical has provided developer with open source since 2004, helping them build innovations such as public cloud, machine learning, robotics or blockchain. The role of a Talent Analytics Lead at CanonicalOur Talent Science team brings deep analytical thinking to how we assess our Global talent. We are pioneering experts changing how an organisation thinks about building its talent. With a Hiring Leadership team that owns and runs our hiring process, our team is responsible for developing advanced insights into the decisions we are making with the ability to best predict performances in the workplace. We are leading the way on how an organisation builds itself through identifying exceptional people, holding the highest standards whilst searching in a globally remote world.This is a unique opportunity to connect the science behind hiring to enable us to attract game changing talent. We are highly data driven, using advanced analytics to assess the effectiveness of our process. We are responsible for ensuring our assessment process helps our leaders identify exceptional talent. We also bring deep thinking on psychometric assessments and conduct in depth behavioural interviews to provide insights on drivers and motivations of our people.We are looking for an experienced talent leader that has proven experience of driving world class talent initiatives. Being highly data centric you will have the ability to drive change through insights and analytics, and bring unique ways to measure talent in the tech marketplace. The suitable individual will bring experience of data science, creating and using dashboarding to influence and drive our processes together with experience of conducting behavioral and psychometric assessments.This role is home based in EMEA.What your day will look likeIn this role you will:Lead a team of data driven behavioural experts, responsible for ensuring that our leadership teams are selecting game changing talent for our organisation. Building and driving deep dive analytics that impact the decisions we make when assessing talent in the Tech industry. Build key relationships with global Hiring Leadership stakeholders to drive our hiring agenda. Be seen as a thought leader on talent initiatives with an inherent belief that past performance predicts future success. Conduct in-depth behavioral talent interviews providing considerable insights into motivations and behaviours of talent. Review our assessment effectiveness to drive continuous improvement. Ensure our Employer branding and DEI initiatives support and drive an inclusive environment for our people. What we are looking for in youAn exceptional academic track record with a degree in psychology or a science based subject with a data science/analytical background. Programming experience with advanced capability to build dashboards, manipulate large datasets and create complex metrics to drive positive behavioural change (SQL, Python, Scripting capabilities). Management experience overseeing data driven experts in the talent field including managing projects that drive efficiency and deliver results. Thought leadership in the talent space with the ability to influence best practice, bringing a solid point of how to build a high performance organisation. Experience of running and providing stakeholder training on behavioural, competency based interviews. Experience of interpreting psychometric assessments with a deep belief that motivations and behaviours are as important as technical domain skills. Proven ability of working with senior stakeholders to drive a professional outlook on hiring talent as well as challenge the status quo. Passionate about building a great employer brand and candidate experience. Experience of successful configuration of hiring tools that enable the selection process. Willingness to travel up to 4 times a year for internal eventsWhat we offer youYour base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. We're constantly on the lookout for experienced software architects of different backgrounds to join our fun-loving bunch. What is the job like, really?The job we're offering is to work as a Senior Software Architect on our customer projects with modern web, mobile, IoT, or product-based solutions. With your senior-level competency and experience, you most likely know what the job consists of without even reading this text any further. In short, you not only know how to describe our clients' problems in terms of business but also how to turn them into technical solution packages.Our customer base and the scope of our projects are wide, from small start-ups to globally large enterprises, and from legacy-type maintenance to hipster-friendly AR/VR projects. You can find examples of our implementations on our website www.vincit.com/work.Like with the consultancy business, the life cycle of our projects and the size of teams varies so there is no need to worry about getting stuck or bored. Our projects can be demanding, but you'll be able to handle that together with your future teammates as they are at the top of their game.What are we looking for?🎯 If you have a solid and versatile history in software development as well as experience in modern development methods, you're just the person we’re looking for!🎯 Our projects make use of diverse technologies (like React, Angular, Vue, Java/Kotlin, Node.js, C#/.NET, and Python/Django), so we hope you’re well-versed in at least a couple of them🎯 Our code is typically AWS-, GCP- or Azure-based, depending on the need. It's great if you know your way around them🎯 In addition to having a diverse skill set, we expect you to approach consulting with a can-do attitude and to confidently claim your space in our clients’ projects🎯 When it comes to defining what "culture fit" means to us, we believe in positivity and willingness to be part of our communityCool, but what's in it for me?🌟 Maximal flexibility and location independence – set up your workstation wherever you want and utilize our awesome offices’ premises in the way you feel is most suitable for you🌟 Work-life balance – we encourage you to shape your work life according to your personal needs🌟 More than generous employee benefits – lunch benefit, free snacks and drinks, healthcare and dental care services, extensive insurance, childcare services, freely selected work equipment and phones – the list goes on!🌟 Competitive salary – your monthly salary will be based on your experience and expertise + you’ll naturally get to enjoy Vincit’s bonus model, personnel fund and transparent salary weeks🌟 Competence development – we have set up Univincity to support workplace learning in various ways🌟 Various career opportunities – take whatever career steps feel appropriate, whether shifting upwards, sideways or downwards.🌟 Modern, transparent, and humane organization culture – thanks to these traits, we're an award-winning workplace to be proud of🌟 Local and international work environment – enjoy the numerous activities and hobby clubs in your local community, go for an office exchange to our Lisbon office, or take a 2-year expat adventure to Vincit U.S.🌟 A team of skilled experts at least equal to yourself – our way of working and thinking usually suits those who are, or want to be, at the top of their profession. Work with us and you get to be part of our Vincit community which consists of the country’s top developers, designers, and other experts.Curious but still on the fence?If there’s anything you’d like to chat about the job, don’t hesitate to get in touch with us. To get to know us as an employer, we recommend checking www.vincit.com/careers-at-vincitP.S. Please note that if you live abroad and want to work with us, you need to have the necessary permits for working in Finland.

We are now looking for an experienced Cloud Architect to join our top-notch team and help us build outstanding solutions and better tomorrow for our strategic customers.What is the job like, really?Your job is to help us design and implement cloud architectures and continuous delivery CI/CD pipelines to support software development projects. You will work as a key member of our software engineering teams to ensure successful agile software delivery. You will have the opportunity to design and implement green-field cloud architectures as well as modernize existing customer environments using the latest cloud technologies.Our customer base and the scope of our projects are wide, from small start-ups to globally large enterprises, and from legacy-type maintenance to hipster-friendly AR/VR projects. You can find examples of our implementations on our website www.vincit.com/work.Like with the consultancy business, the life cycle of our projects and the size of teams varies so there is no need to worry about getting stuck or bored. Our projects can be demanding, but you'll be able to handle that together with your future teammates as they are at the top of their game.What are we looking for?🎯 We hope you have practical experience in at least one of the top cloud platforms (AWS/GCP/Azure) and possibly an associate-level cloud certification.🎯 Infrastructure-as-code (IaC) and knowledge of container technologies such as Docker and/or Kubernetes are essential in this job. Your toolkit may include, for example, Terraform, AWS CDK, Pulumi, Cloudformation, Ansible, GitLab CI, Azure DevOps or Github Actions. Our projects are typically implemented with NodeJS, Java, .NET, Django, ReactJS, Next.JS, Angular or Java/Spring technologies.🎯 Background in software development and architecture is a major benefit but not mandatory. Skills related to cybersecurity and DevSecOps tools are considered a great advantage. 🎯 In addition to having a diverse skill set, we expect you to have fluent communication skills in Finnish and English and approach consulting with a can-do attitude and to confidently claim your space in our clients’ projects.🎯 When it comes to defining what "culture fit" means to us, we believe in positivity and willingness to be part of our community. Cool, but what's in it for me?🌟 Maximal flexibility and location independence – set up your workstation wherever you want and utilize our awesome offices’ premises in the way you feel is most suitable for you🌟 Work-life balance – we encourage you to shape your work life according to your personal needs🌟 More than generous employee benefits – lunch benefit, free snacks and drinks, healthcare and dental care services, extensive insurance, childcare services, freely selected work equipment and phones – the list goes on!🌟 Competitive salary – your monthly base salary will be based on your experience and expertise + you’ll naturally get to enjoy Vincit’s bonus model, personnel fund and transparent salary weeks🌟 Competence development – we have set up Univincity to support workplace learning in various ways🌟 Various career opportunities – take whatever career steps feel appropriate, whether shifting upwards, sideways or downwards.🌟 Modern, transparent, and humane organization culture – thanks to these traits, we're an award-winning workplace to be proud of🌟 Local and international work environment – enjoy the numerous activities and hobby clubs in your local community, go for an office exchange to our Lisbon office, or take a 2-year expat adventure to Vincit U.S.🌟 A team of skilled experts at least equal to yourself – our way of working and thinking usually suits those who are, or want to be, at the top of their profession. Work with us and you get to be part of our Vincit community which consists of the country’s top developers, designers, and other experts.Curious but still on the fence?If there’s anything you’d like to chat about the job, don’t hesitate to get in touch with us. To get to know us as an employer, we recommend checking www.vincit.com/careers-at-vincitP.S. Please note that if you live abroad and want to work with us, you need to have the necessary permits for working in Finland.
